image.altText: A man with long hair smiling

props.synopsis: The man charged with murdering Victorian woman Samantha Murphy can be revealed as Patrick Orren Stephenson, after his lawyer dropped a bid to have the 22-year-old's name suppressed.

title.children: Patrick Orren Stephenson named as Samantha Murphy's accused killer after suppression order ends

image.altText: A man in his 60s with long hair, wearing glasses walks out of court.

props.synopsis: A North Queensland paedophile who pressured a woman for images of her young niece in exchange for money has been released into the community after two years in prison.

title.children: 'Deplorable' paedophile who targeted toddler released after high-profile child exploitation case folds

image.altText: Sam Kerr looks ahead during a 2023 Women's World Cup match.

props.synopsis: The governing body has been in touch with Sam Kerr, while appealing for respect for the court proceedings surrounding the Matildas captain's case.

title.children: Football Australia reaffirms support for Kerr amid racial harassment allegations

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: The State of the Union address rolls around every year, but for US President Joe Biden, the stakes of this speech couldn't have been higher. These were the big moments.

title.children: When Biden got up to make a high stakes speech, he decided to address the elephant in the room

image.altText: A man wearing a car backwards stands by a bright green car, with its doors open.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man pleads guilty to robbery with an offensive weapon over an incident in which he pointed a gun at tennis player Nick Kyrgios's mother and demanded the keys to his car before driving away in it.

title.children: Canberra man pleads guilty to stealing Nick Kyrgios's Tesla at gunpoint

image.altText: A police van and forensic crews set up outside a block of units

props.synopsis: Investigations are underway in the northern NSW town of Evans Head after a woman's body was found in a car. Police sources say the woman had suffered stab wounds.

title.children: Woman's body found in boot of car, son arrested

image.altText: A man in a shirt, tie and jacket stands with the Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background.

props.synopsis: The headmaster of the private Sydney boys' school, which is preparing to go co-educational, supported a teacher who sent sexually explicit messages to a former female student.

title.children: Cranbrook School headmaster resigns following new revelations about current teacher

image.altText: A rugby league player celebrates after scoring a try

props.synopsis: New Zealand have started the season with a bang and are dominating the Sharks early. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Warriors dominating as Sharks flounder in season opener

image.altText: Kris Mietus and Prue Mayne speak about Marc Mietus.

props.synopsis: Police have issued a $500,000 reward for information about the suspected murder of a man missing from near Bundaberg since 2000.

title.children: Father of suspected murder victim makes emotional plea as police launch fresh search for evidence

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood gives a thumbs up during a game

props.synopsis: Josh Hazlewood bowls like a dream to take a deserved five-wicket haul, including dismissing Kane Williamson in his 100th Test, as Australia burns one review in hilarious fashion before stealing a wicket with a speculator. Here's the five quick hits from day one of the Christchurch Test.

title.children: Five quick hits — the strangest of caught behind appeals and Hazlewood gets five

image.altText: Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden Facebook

props.synopsis: Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden has been suspended on full pay since late last year after being charged with the murder of his stepfather. Whether he gets a second term is in the hands of 20,000-odd voters.

title.children: How can a councillor charged with murder run for re-election?

image.altText: A man with tattoos punching a man holding boxing gloves.

props.synopsis: Exercise helps with mental and physical health for everyone, but people with disabilities face significant barriers when trying to go to the gym.

title.children: Jason was told he should stay home on sports day growing up, now he's fighting adversity at the gym

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man holding a pizza box open standing next to another person.

props.synopsis: Italian born Alberto Nicoletti, 32, gives evidence in his own defence at his five-week trial on charges of abusing eight women at various locations around Perth.

title.children: Perth restaurateur says allegations he sexually assaulted eight women are 'totally false'

image.altText: A composite of a  tree-lined dirt track extending away into the bush, and a thin smiling woman with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: A social media movement honouring Victorian woman, Samantha Murphy, who was allegedly murdered, is picking up speed across Australia.

title.children: '#RunforSamantha' gaining traction as tributes flow for Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A woman in the middle of ballot boxes pictured from above.

props.synopsis: There are calls for change to the way Indonesia conducts elections after 115 staff died during and in the days after the country's national poll last month.

title.children: More than 100 officials died after the world's biggest single-day election in Indonesia

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf speaks after hearing into unlawful termination from ABC

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission hearing into Antoinette Lattouf's dismissal from the ABC hears that David Anderson received "many complaints" about her that he forwarded to colleagues.

title.children: ABC received complaints about Antoinette Lattouf on her first day on air, commission told

image.altText: The wheel of a plane noticeably stuck in grass slightly of the tarmac of a runway

props.synopsis: One outback resident says she forked out almost $4,000 to get home after a 48-hour Rex flight delay, and feels "left in the dark" over the airline's failure to communicate.

title.children: 'Unreliable' Rex flights have essential workers reconsidering remote jobs

image.altText: Jefferson Do wears a navy shirt and smiles in front of a plate of food at a restaurant.

props.synopsis: A support worker has faced court accused of leaving a non-verbal man with autism in a hot car during a searing Perth heatwave, as his family thanks passers-by who freed him.

title.children: Family of non-verbal man who was allegedly left in car during heatwave speak out as carer faces court

image.altText: Alastair Clarkson

props.synopsis: The AFL sanctions North Melbourne coach Alastair Clarkson, describing his abuse of St Kilda players Jimmy Webster and Dougal Howard during a preseason match as "highly inappropriate".

title.children: Clarkson fined $20,000, handed suspended ban after 'unacceptable' verbal abuse

image.altText: akira

props.synopsis: Akira Toriyama passed away on March 1 due to a serious brain condition, the official Dragon Ball franchise has said in a statement.

title.children: Dragon Ball Z comic creator Akira Toriyama dies suddenly aged 68 while in the middle of new creations

image.altText: Samah stands in the middle of the protest crowd, wearing a black and white shirt.

props.synopsis: There are calls to return International Women's Day to its protest roots over fears organisations are placating women in place of addressing gender inequality.

title.children: 'Ask women to get up early and come to something outside work hours': The paradox of International Women's Day

image.altText: A little girl, holding an empty white bowl, frowns as she lines up with others who are also holding empty food containers

props.synopsis: A formal conclusion that famine has arrived in Gaza could come next week. But how is a famine officially declared? And as widespread hunger grips the region, why hasn't it been announced already?

title.children: US to build temporary port to deliver Gaza aid as widespread famine looms

image.altText: Joe Biden, suit with blue tie, using both hands to point to a crowd while speaking.

props.synopsis: From reproductive rights to the state of democracy — the US president has outlined his vision for a second term in his State of the Union address. Look back over our live coverage of the speech.

title.children: Joe Biden sets out his vision in State of the Union address — as it happened

image.altText: A woaman in a white coat with long brown hair prepares to toss a coin behind her into the Trevi Fountain

props.synopsis: For hundreds of years, when in Rome, visitors have flocked to the fountain to make a wish, following a storied ritual. Few gave their coins a second thought.

title.children: What happens to coins tossed in the Trevi fountain?

image.altText: A woman with her back to the camera holds ice to the back of her neck as she sits at a desk

props.synopsis: Superannuation funds warn that tens of thousands of Australian women are being left tens of thousands of dollars worse off in retirement due to career breaks triggered by severe menopausal symptoms.

title.children: Menopause 'has a direct impact on superannuation', so why is it hardly discussed?

image.altText: A small living room, with a beige couch, oval glass coffee table and cat stretched out on a floor rug.

props.synopsis: Dramatic before and after shots of redecorated rooms in our social media feeds can be satisfying to scroll through, but feel out of reach. Taking a slower approach to home decorating can help you make more considered choices and improve your environmental footprint.

title.children: The benefits of taking an unhurried approach to home decorating

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: It's the case that has captivated the nation, but despite murder charges being laid over the disappearance of Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy, the missing facts about what happened will keep people asking questions.

title.children: Murder charges over Samantha Murphy's disappearance unlikely to stop the questions

image.altText: An orange logo with the word TEMU is seen on the screen of a phone held up by a hand in front of ads on a computer

props.synopsis: The cost-of-living crisis has seen Shein and Temu become major players in online retail, but their meteoric rise comes at the expense of local businesses. Is this the end of e-commerce as we know it, or could these brands crash and burn?

title.children: The rise of Temu and Shein in Australia is the result of 'a perfect storm'. Are they here to stay?

image.altText: A woman of Asian background with long hair standing out the front of an HSBC bank branch

props.synopsis: Australians are continuing to lose their life savings to a long-running "spoofing" scam targeting customers of banking giant HSBC.

title.children: 'Oh my God, another one': A long-running text scam is still costing Australians their life savings

image.altText: A close-up photo of Elizabeth holding baby Mary and kissing her forehead.

props.synopsis: Ninety per cent of pregnancies are terminated when prenatal screening predicts Down syndrome. Liz Smith chose to continue with her pregnancy but says she has been traumatised by her experience with the medical system.

title.children: After Liz gave birth, a nurse asked her if she planned to take baby Mary home

image.altText: A cricket player bowling with the size of the ball blown up into a close up look graphic

props.synopsis: It is one of the most devastating weapons a fast bowler can own — but the art of swing is steeped in mystery and myths that only science can explain.

title.children: 'The whole mystery was revealed': The science of what makes a cricket ball swing explained

image.altText: A row of white electric vehicles lined up in a showroom.

props.synopsis: ASX closes on another record high, Polestar becomes latest electric vehicle maker to quit Australia's car lobby over the government's proposed CO2 emissions scheme, following Tesla's resignation on Thursday.

title.children: ASX hits another record high, Polestar follows Tesla's lead and quits car lobby over CO2 emissions scheme — as it happened

image.altText: A man holding a gun amid soldiers.

props.synopsis: As North Korea abandons the decades-long goal of reunification with the South, experts are tabling different interpretations on what lies ahead.

title.children: Gifts from Putin and a shift in rhetoric: Why experts think North Korea's war mongering has just turned real
